meanings.definition: Make white or pale by extracting color; bleach.
meanings.sent1: She blanched the fabric to remove the red wine stain.
meanings.sent2: The chef blanched the almonds before adding them to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The sun blanched the curtains hanging by the window.
meanings.sent4: His sudden fear blanched his face, making him look ghostly.
meanings.sent5: The snow-capped mountains blanched under the bright moonlight.

meanings.definition: To scald in boiling water or steam.
meanings.sent1: The cook was blanching the vegetables for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent2: She blanched the tomatoes to easily peel off the skin.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally blanched its paw in the hot water.
meanings.sent4: The steam from the pot blanched her face as she leaned over it.
meanings.sent5: The heat from the sauna blanched his skin, turning it pink.
